review: 4 stars for my recent visit. The staff were friendly and attentive; the restaurant was clean, bathroom as well (I can't speak for the men's since I can't go in there!); the food was good.  I ordered the fajita trio- which you can choose 3 types of protein... It came with 3 flour tortillas, sour cream, guac, cheese, salsa, and tomatoes. It was very good! Meats were really tender and flavored so well--- I wasn't expecting that from Chili's! It fed the 2 of us adults with some to spare! It only costed $16.99. (The only thing I will say is that the presentation of the sides could've been a little more appetizing, and they could've given more tortillas or at least stop by and ask if we needed more tortillas... ) What was even better was we happen to come when kids eat free. So my daughter got her fave, grilled cheese, and her side choice of mashed potatoes. I tried the potato and it was so good it had to be artery clogging good. That's a good-bad thing   Bill with tax and tip came out to $25-and I didn't even have to wait for the server to give us our check. The tables have little tablets you can pay from! Good service & food, no waiting time, free meal--can't beat that!

Just wanted to give a shout out to this Chili's. I brought my class of like skills special education students to practice different skills and the staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. We really appreciate it and will be back!

I almost never write reviews of big chain restaurants, but I've been to this Chili's several times in the past few months because it's my son's new favorite restaurant and after half a dozen meals there I have some good things to say about it: 1) The staff currently running the place seem to really have their act together. There's usually a wait on weekend nights, but you're right in the middle of one of the last decent shopping centers on the north shore, so there's stuff to do and see while you wait, and they'll just text you when your table is ready, which I thought was a convenient and handy touch. The place is clean and well-appointed and there are always plenty of staff on hand to direct traffic, clean tables and places, seat guests, and take orders. Their attentiveness is broadly excellent by any standard, which was one of the first things I noticed because it's usually what's missing in chain restaurants like this. 2) The drinks and orders come out quickly and correctly every single time, despite the fact that they do get very busy at peak mealtimes. For me, this translates once more into strong management and staff that know what they're doing. Their teamwork seems smooth and seamless when shift changes or unexpected things like large parties show up and land on them. No one ever seems stressed or quietly irritated, and a couple of occasions we even got a friendly conversation with our servers who made a good show of treating us like we were the only table in the place for those five minutes. When you work at full-speed, as these folks do, that kind of adaptability, professionalism, and consistency is almost like a magic trick.  3) They have these little iPad things for kids to play with at their meals and on which you can pay your bill directly instead of having the waitstaff take your card. It's convenient enough for what it is, and my son certainly appreciates the distraction and games, but the only star I'm taking off for this review is that these things cost $1.99 to use every time. It's not horrible, and I buy it every time for my kid, but I'd much rather give the servers the extra $2 for the great job they're doing than feel like I'm renting a piece of technology we have a better one of at home. Know what I mean? Just buy a couple dozen of these things and eat the cost and let us bask in the superb flow of the place without a $1.99 frowny face on the bill. 4) The food is mostly consistent with other Chili's restaurants, but it's only positives here too. They never scrimp on anything, seasonings really grab you, plates generously overflow, empty bowls of salsa or other condiments are refreshed instantly and without having to be asked, the drinks are satisfyingly mixed and their drink menu has just the right amount of variety. Their lava cake threatens to give you diabetes, but you sweets-lovers will get this every time because it's delicious and the right size for two. Speaking of two: they offer a "dinner for two" one-price special where you pick a starter, mains, desert, and drinks. Totally worth it. Last time my wife and I had the half-rack of ribs and Margarita Grilled Chicken which were both delicious (the ribs especially), and I drank both of the included, salted house margaritas myself. Reasonably priced and perfect, and I left our attentive server a 30% tip with zero regrets.  In a way, this Chili's answers some interesting questions about what a restaurant with machine-enhanced service could look like, and I'm happy to report that it looks... good? Who would have thought? There still seems to be plenty of people in the kitchen and dining room, and if anything the little iPad things that can take orders and check you out free up the rest of the staff to just make your experience better. I would feel bad if that kind of tech cost anyone their job, regardless of how much convenience or efficiency it offered, and I didn't get the sense that that was the case at all at this Chili's. The verdict: keep up the great work, guys (especially whoever is managing this place). We'll be back.

Well the food here is decent as well as their prices.  The experience itself had much to be desired.. went early on a Thursday so not many people there.  Waiter was nice but I think he was a bit frazzled cause I think he was the only server there.  My Strawberry Daiquiri was terrible, had salt around the rim and tasted awful.   When the waiter came back with a new drink I realized that the bartender most likely poured the drink in another glass w/o salt on the rim.   I put it on the edge of the table and said I just stick with water... no apologies, or asking what was wrong with the drink.  The management needs to run the business a bit better, probably not going back there any time soon.

My wife and I have Iowa ID's because that's where we're from, and we're temporary residents in IL, so they advise you to not change your ID unless you plan on becoming a permanent resident. You also cannot renew an Iowa ID until it expires, not before. You renew online and they send you a new one through the mail, your old one remaining valid until your new one arrives. We're both 24. The doorman was very nice, the waitress who seated us was nice, the manager tried his best to be nice, but in the end he kept saying his 'hands were tied' when they really were not. He 'couldn't' accept my wife's ID, even with my wife being 6 months older than me. If he would of scanned it, he would have seen it was a valid ID, but he said they don't have an ID scanner. That would have been fine, had the manager been sensible. Common sense should have gotten us through this whole situation, as I lay out below. 1) The ID had her age and birth date on it. Last I checked, going backwards in age when renewing an expired license isn't something the DMV offers. 2) If you thought it was fake, maybe then think, 'why would someone have a fake EXPIRED license?' who the hell would be that stupid? Furthermore, 'Why would a wife bring a fake expired license, while her husband brought a real non-expired license, right next to her?' Without a scanner, a fake ID with a non-expired date could easily pass your eye inspection, but our real IDs couldn't. Wait, oops, just my (6-month-older-than-me) wife's couldn't... 3) If you're going to have a policy on a manager checking all 'out-of-state' IDs, common sense tells us that having a manager with AT LEAST basic knowledge of how 'out-of-state' IDs work would be appropriate.  We left, but I came back in as we were walking away and calmly told the manager that I was going to leave this very review. He offered to buy us an appetizer, but that didn't make my wife feel any less degraded. I shook his hand and we left. We went to Binny's, used the same IDs to buy some whiskey and then went to Chipotle on McCormick, where we used the same IDs again to buy some beers while we ate. Binny's cards hard. Harder than anywhere. They accepted my wife's ID because it was real. Really wish this place would have seen that. It was freezing out, sleeting and we just wanted to enjoy a night out at someplace a step up from home, but it looks like we'd have been better off inside. For advice? Get a scanner, get some knowledge in out-of-state IDs, but most importantly? Be more human, and get some sensibility.

We shared a triple dipper app consisting of Southwest Egg Rolls, Honey Chipotle BBQ Wings and Cheddar Bites . . . OHH MY GOODNESS those Cheddar Bites were something I've never had, sooo delicious.  I ordered a carnitas burrito with grilled asparagus and bf ordered a Grilled Chicken Burrito with beans.  Loved all of the food, and the music. I noticed a great special for a $6 Old Timer Burger on Wednesdays so I guess I'll be coming back very soon.  I'd definitely recommend coming and sitting in Rhianna's section.   Thank you so much to the staff and management.  We had a lot of fun.

What has happened to this Chili's over the past few years?   I had a craving for the fajitas, so we stopped in for dinner.   We were looking for our standby Potato Skins for an appetizer and evidently they didn't  make the cut on the reworked menu.  We passed on the appetizer and ordered.   Along with wanting fajitas, I also wanted soup, it seems the awesome cheddar broccoli is no longer on the menu either (after being on the menu since forever).  I opted for a cup of the cream of potato soup and that serving size was the smallest I'd ever seen in a restaurant, only about five spoonfuls in total.   it was busy and our entrees were delivered by a manager.  The fajitas were not sizzling as usual and the onions and peppers weren't cooked, just one step over raw.  The other entree, Monterrey Chicken, I was told was "just ok"   Needless to say, it wasn't a great or even good experience.  I really looked forward to those fajitas, I've have had better ones at the TBK down the street

Hardly any meat mostly onions for around $15. We should have known to stay away from a chain restaurant for Mexican food.

I met a friend at the bar area for lunch. The table we sat down on was dirty but the waitress noticed it as soon as she greeted us, and took care of it. We both had a burger and we enjoyed it very much. However we both thought that the fries had way too much seasoning and I did not care for the garlic pickles ( I wished that there was a choice). The only thing that turned our experience off was that the waitress dropped off the check without asking her if we wanted anything else. We both understood that it was shift change and we were fine with closing our check but we thought it should have been handled better.

The waitstaff seem overworked and usually food comes to the table with a long wait as well. One time my husband got upset because our drinks came late and then our appetizers were late and then our main entrees came out just a minute after our appetizers. He asked them to bring the entrees back to the kitchen and keep them warm so that we could enjoy our appetizers. If it weren't for the overworked waitstaff (and by the way I think they are doing the best that they can) I think this place would get mostly 5 star reviews.
Took too long to be served Food needs more flavor, i try the rib eye burrito twice because i thought that it will be different this time but i got disappointed again
They have many choices that I like  and all those I tasted was so good, and coming back love this place and my free appetizers

Sunday go this my kid , have lunch, cant call this plase Mexican grille, but food is ok, service can be better, spend $37 , it ok to have lunch, but iff u looking Mexican- go different places

It us annoying to show up at a restaurant to see a line when half the tables are open.  Bad bad management.  Terrible use of space.  And just lazy staff

The food tasted so good and the ambience was very friendly. I recommend the lunch combo: fresco salad and smoked chicken quesadillas. It was honestly the best salad I have ever tasted. The sauce may be mildly spicy; I normally don't like spicy food, but I crave this sauce each time. I heard the chili steak also tasted very good. I went to this Chili's  today first time it was Awesome the food was great and our server Ashley A+ service. Much Love bartender serves some awesome strawberry margaritas. Thank you Ashley and everyone   working there today August 14 2016 was Great keep up the good work :)

By far the worst experience and service ever. First, ordered drinks and appetizers. Drinks came quick, appetizer however took 35 minutes to come out. Ridiculous! We told the manager we were ready to leave because it shouldn't have taken that long at all. Normally appetizers come out relatively quick. The waiter was apologetic and he comp'd the appetizer. After waiting 35 minutes for the appetizer when it came out we ordered our meals. Meals came out and instead of plates we were given our meals on trays! Yes trays! Ummmm what happened to the plates! Our meal was chicken crispers with fries. Chicken was not good tasted rubbery and they changed how they were made, corn on the cob was seasoned way to much like the seasoning jar opened up on our corn that we had to scrape it off with our knives. And the french fries were soggy. Needless to say very disappointed in our visit to chili's this evening. Will think twice before we return.

I actually like(d) this Chili's, been there many times before, without a problem.. til today.  Maybe I should chalk it up to it just being my 1st experience with the "To Go" side of the restaurant.   But it'll most likely be the last.   I ordered online at approximately 4:08 PM, to which they gave a 4:25 PM pick-up time.  I had a stop to make and I wanted to give ample time to have the food prepared when I got there, so I arrived at around 4:40 PM.  A guy at the register asked if I was there for a "pick-up" order, I said yes, he asked my name, I gave it, and he said he'd be right with me.  I sat down.  After sitting there trying to pass the time by entertaining myself with my phone, my battery eventually died.  So after watching servers and waitresses repeatedly pass me with drinks and enormous platters of food, I eventually asked a girl at the register calculating receipts if she could find out if my order was going to be ready.  She said sure, and I never saw her again.  After about 10 more minutes, I stopped another waitress to ask if she'd see about my order, she said "sure no problem".  Not long after that, a gentleman whom i assumed also placed an order online, came thru the door.  The girl who I'd stopped came back to me and said that someone was working on my order (Working on it, really???  It was suppose to be DONE 45 minutes ago!!!) and it would be out in "like 30 seconds".   The guy that had just got there, grabbed a menu and stared at it and stood there for maybe 7, then took out his wallet and was greeted by a girl who came to the register with a bag with 2 containers in it.  I figured it had to be mine because by this time I'd been sitting there for over 50 minutes.  But I was wrong.  She said a name, I stood up, I asked her to repeat it, she said it again... the order belonged to the guy at the door.  He pays, takes his food, and leaves.  The girl asks my name, and tell her, and she says my order is coming.  Another person with an online/phone order walks in.  Someone is at the register and the woman gives the name on her order.  Shortly after the girl comes back to the front with another bag.  I'm thinking 'this shit can't be happening again'.  I just sit and wait to see what happens.  The server looks at me and nods, as if to say "your order is (FINALLY) ready".  I get up, I pay, she asks if I want silverware, I say no.  Grab my food, and I leave.  It was 5:45 PM.  As i said previously, I got there at 4:40 PM.  Now... the hour long wait alone would piss most people off to point of asking for a manager, or possibly just saying "F this place!" And leaving, long before reaching the 60 minute mark.  But the thing that kills me is, how can u suggest a pick-up time, I get there 15 minutes AFTER, and I then wait ANOTHER hour+ to receive something that was suppose to be ready for pick up 15 minutes before I even got there???  I'll say, the guy that came in after me received his food in a much more timely manner.  I'm never one that likes to pull or play the race-card, because I feel people rely on it to heavily and are too quick to jump to that conclusion, when that isn't ALWAYS the case.  So altho that gentleman happened to be... "fairer skinned".. I won't do it in this case.  I just dont necessarily feel there was enough to support that claim.  I'll just say the service was absolutely ridiculous.  The food was good tho.  Which is the reason for 2 stars, instead of one. But as far as online or phone orders to this particular location, this is the 1st and last time.

There was a fun ambience in this place. We did have a subtle time of eating out here coz the design of the room was literally soothing even if there was a lot of people. Just like in their other branches in and out of the country, their foods remained above normal level of preparation. The price for all of the stuff we got were not cheap because this restaurant deserved that range too. It was just that, it took long before we got our foods.

I've been to this Chili's many times over the years. I was always so-so on this place. Service is usually pretty friendly, food is fine and generally comes out pretty quick, and there's usually pretty ample parking. However, when I went there last Thursday, I had a terrible experience. Really, what it comes down to is that we were blatantly lied to, in the hopes of getting our business.  Let me explain. I had decided to meet a friend at the Buffalo Wild Wings in the same mall. When I arrived there, I was told the wait would be an hour. An hour wait? On a random Thursday night? No thanks. Before we even moved the car an inch to drive somewhere else, my friend called Chili's to see what their wait time was like. No wait at all, we were told. Come right in! That worked for us. We drove over to Chili's (which is maybe a block-ish from Buffalo Wild Wings, MAYBE). We arrived there no more than 2 minutes after the call was made. We walked in, and saw a ton of people waiting to be seated. What? How could that be? My friend walked up to the host, who was CLEARLY the gentleman who had answered the call, and asked to be seated. He told her there was a 15-20 minute wait. I'm sorry, what?!?! She told him that she had just called, and even showed him her cell phone call log. She even asked if he was the person she spoke with. He had no answers and just kept saying there was a 15-20 minute wait. We were pretty ticked off, to say the least. We would have been way more understanding if he had at least apologized for the miscommunication, or even during the phone call, told us about the wait and offered to put our name on the wait list ahead of our arrival. He did neither and tried to really undermine our intelligence. After the whole confrontation, another woman who was waiting came and asked us if we had been told there was no wait (I guess she overheard the conversation). We said yes, and she told us that they had done the same thing to her. She had a bigger problem than we did though, as she was calling to confirm no wait time because she had a child with special needs who would not handle the wait time well. To avoid a meltdown, she had called to assure her family could come in and sit to eat right away. She said they had been waiting for about 10 minutes, and her husband had taken their child out of the restaurant so as to avoid behaviors from the child during the long wait time. I'm sorry, but this is just wholly and completely unacceptable. Chili's, don't have your host lie to customers about the wait. There's no excuse for it.  I will not be back to this location again.

If you like your food with so much salt you can feel your blood pressure rise as you're eating, then you'll like this place.  I asked the waitress to taste the soup and she agreed with me. Told the manager, he didn't care.

Coming to this Chili's is always a hit or miss sometimes... I came here on Friday night. as to be expected it was extremely packed the wait time was about 45 mins... YESSSS.... I KNOW I did wait I was already there and considering driving to another place and waiting a little there is about the same experience.  I  assume the man working the front seating and greeting the customers was the General Manager or maybe the shift manager that night.  I will say he was friendly and did greet everyone and asked your preference of dining table, which was appreciated and he gave us the expected wait time which was 45. He was also nice enough to let us know that the bar was first come first serve if a table came available we would just have to wait to for some one to clean it.  Once we were seated we were browsing the menu for quite some time before some one even came to tell us they were our waiter. We already knew what we wanted to eat for appetizer and dinner.   Took him a bit to come with our drinks. We received our appetizer first which... THANK THE GODS OF FOOD lol.. Because I was starving.. We ordered a trio sampler with egg rolls, wings and little burgers all of it was pretty .. I must say the wings were delicious tho they stood out the most to me.  For my main course I got a 60z steak medium rare with mashed and veggies. OF COURSE I LOVED THE MASHED POTATOES the steak was okay wasn't bad but I've had better.  Overall the FOOD portion of our night wasn't bad.  But the Waiter was just not attentive food came out served and he was really gone for most of the night..  and to this day I'm being made fun of for leaving an "over generous" tip for a crappy service.  Will I come back??... I'm sure eventually but I'm not going out of my way anytime soon.

Terrible horrible service, had a long day at work to order my phone to pick it up. I was there 45 mins later after my call. They told me the three away my food so I have to wait another 30 mins!! Who the fuck throw away food without calling me back!! Dumb ass employees avoid at all cost!

Our server brandy was great and the manager Christy was awesome. As a veteran they went out of their way for me. Thank you! The shrimp and prime rib fajitas were excellent. Service was very good.

So I came here the other night and may I say that my server was very rude. As far as the restaurant itself, it was very messy and the floors were so sticky and dirty. It got to the point as to where we wanted to walk out but me and my date were hungry.  I ordered a Patron Margarita and it seemed like they filled it 60% of the way. I was so unhappy with my visit here and I don't think I'll come back for a while.

I really love that you can go here with your family or, with friends and you always get a  very patient and nice server!  The staff works hard to please the customers and this brings back customers (like myself), over & over again! The SouthWestern Egg Rolls taste so good!!

Came here on a Saturday evening with my friends and it was a long wait at least 30 minutes. Service was ok the food was good also. My first drink I didn't ready taste the alcohol but the second was on point. After  We got the bill had to wait and flag the waiter down to come and get Bill but otherwise I will come back. .
We love this place and loved our waitress her name was Caitlin she's great! We'll be coming back soon!

In the restaurant as I write this. It took over 20 minutes for our soup to arrive at the table. After finishing the soup it took another 20 minutes for our entrées to arrive. After the entrées arrived we noticed we had no silverware and as the manager walked by I asked him for a refill on my drink and silverware so we could begin eating and the manager gave me an attitude. Instead of the manager getting us our silverware and drink refills he had our waiter get it which took another 5 minutes. In short, i love the food but the service was exceptionally horrible today and it reminds me why I don't frequent Chili's.

I was here about 5 months ago, and now just got a chance to leave a review here, me and my wife we got an order of texas fries, but what we had at this location it had the same look but horrible taste !! potatoes  where so old that I can not explain the smell and taste! other than a bad food I spoke to a manager who told me if you are not happy you could leave!!! so I would recommend if you want to have some good food, good night out, and relax do not go here, I wasted my night here and could not eat anything after what I experienced there!!!

Had excellent service from Booker last night. He was energetic and attentive. Every single seat in the restaurant was filled but our service was not compromised at all. My son has very serious dairy allergies and they provide a a dairy free or allergy specialty menu and there were no issues in regards to how our food was prepared.  My boyfriend and I split the 2 for $20 and used a coupon so our son could eat free. So it was price effective and everyone went home happy and full, not much more you can ask for when it comes to casual chain restaurants.  I'll be back to this Chili's as opposed to the one in downtown Evanston.

Can't believe I haven't written a review for here yet as I've literally been coming for over the last decade!  Chili's has NEVER done anything but please me and everybody I come with! Their service is PHENOMENAL!!! I can literally go on and on at how amazing our server Alesha was on my last visit and we had a tiny glitch with the bill that the manager Terrell fixed instantly and kindly for us! I can literally go on and on about their service alone but I'm sure reviewing the food would also be helpful! Their Honey Chipotle Chicken Crispers (or even the Honey Chipotle wings) are amazing! They are my go to for many years! They added a Roasted Street style corn option on the menu which is delicious! For app, we usually do the triple dipper with their southwest eggrolls, onion rings, and honey chipotle chicken wings. The eggrolls are not your typical eggrolls, they are filled with lots of good stuff like corn and spinach and have a pleasant, spicy kick to them. The tostada chips and guac are always on point with their warm chips too! I've had the mango lime grilled chicken a couple times as well, their fajitas and quesadillas, and almost all their soups and salads and they NEVER disappoint!!!! I could literally eat here everyday!  For dessert my go to has always been the molten chocolate cake.... it is literally to die for!!! They came out with a mini molten and also a caramel molten but all in all, the regular Molten Chocolate takes the cake! Their other chocolate chip cookie a la mode dessert is good too. All in all, I can say great service, great food, and reasonable prices. I am, as always, super pleased!

Actually a great place for dinner for a chain restaurant, I Love the volcano chocolate cake. My friend and I have been having dinner here before we watch a movie and we like to order the meal for two deal, share an app, each has an entree, and share a dessert. You also have an option to add a margarita which is good. The portions are pretty large for a meal deal.  The ribs was cooked perfectly had it with house bbq sauce. My friend had the bbq chicken quesadillas (they gave her alot) and I can't gush enough how I love the volcano cake! If I didn't need protein I can so totally have the cake for dinner.  Service is good, we usually stay by the bar. Love the tablet machine thing on the table where u can order your food. Which is good if it gets too busy and the waiter gets bogged down. Plus you can pay using the machine and you can easily split the bill too!

The only thing i like at chili's is their fajitas. Service could be A LOT better. Waitress forgot we existed. Food is okay, nothing spectacular. Not authentic either. They tend to have false advertising.... because last time i was there, right as you walk in there was a sign saying "kids eat for free on Tuesday". Well, it was Tuesday and my daughter's meal still showed up on the receipt.  And for some reason, the women's bathroom always looks like it got teepeed... :/

I love and hate this place. They make good food, but one day you can be lucky and get great service/food and then another day you can get the worst there's ever been. There's no in-between with this location.  I will keep coming back though. I like their chicken.

I must confess that I love chilis Chips and Queso appetizer.  I ordered this while waiting for a friend to meet me for lunch.  Our lunch date was planned for 12 noon, so I arrived at 11:50 to secure a table and order us a celebratory margarita.  My friend just learned that she is going to get a job with NASA.  She will help space ship development for some lunar mission.   WOW!  I sat down and ordered the chips and queso.  It came out quick.  10 minutes pass and I am half way through it.  Then another 4 minutes pass and I am scraping the bottom of the bowl.  No problem, I asked for another order.  She arrived 19 minutes late just as the new chips and queso arrived.  I demurred when she asked me to dig in.  We polished off that plate and ordered fajitas.  I wasn't hungry so I took them home.  I later had indigestion. 5 stars for QUESO!

I have been coming to this Chili's for many years. The food is decent, and you can get a lot of food for really cheap. My biggest issue with this location is their crowd control. if you come after 6 pm on a Friday or Saturday, be prepared to wait. Unfortunately, it is so crowded that you cannot get a seat at the bar, and you may not be able to sit on the bench. Also, you do not want to walk away for a bit to do shopping in Village Crossing since they may call your name and put you at the end of the list.  The servers also seem overwhelmed at times. Our last server was great, but you can tell she was exhausted from all the people.

Great deals on the two for 20.00 Service was ok. Food meh. Company was the best. Nice lively atmosphere nice energy. Steak tastex bland and my corn was luke warm at best on the ends. Bbq sause tasted like a tangy tomato ketchup. Not great, not bad...just meh.

It's not that I don't like to wait to be seated, but what makes me mad is when the person you make a reservation over the phone says it's 20 mins and when you get there it's another 15 min wait. Apparently Wednesday night seems to be busy for them... Unfortunately, after we got seated we got an additional 7 min wait before our waitress saw us. My nephew got kids meal pizza, I really liked the Boneless buffalo chicken salad but the Southern smokehouse burger which comes with Chili's signature BBQ sauce I didn't like the BBQ sauce; however, the burger was OK! And seriously more waiting when all I wanted was a refill for my nephew's drink and a to-go styrofoam container and possibly better BBQ sauce. After paying I just wanted to leave and what made it worse is after I paid and clicked for a copy of receipt, the tablet went into a reboot...I would have to reconsider going back here.

I had a great experience here! The service was very quick and attentive. I didn't have to wait a long time and server was quick. I got an appetizer for around 13.00 and it had boneless wings, cheese bites, and egg rolls. Everything was very delicious and well cooked. Came with three different sauces and was so tasty. Good appetizer or even lunch plate to eat.

This is one of my favorite chain restaurants . I highly recommend the $35 meal plan for two . You get one appetizer ( recommended : loaded fries ), 2 entrees ( recommended : mango-chillo chicken ) one dessert ( caramel mount cake) , and two margaritas . Each margarita is enough  to refill the cup three times ! For the price you're paying I think you get a great deal . The waiting list for the table is about 25 minutes but you can always get a seat in the bar or the little area next to it . It's first come first serve so just stay around and you'll get a seat quick . Servers take a while to go to your table too.
Honestly I love this place. Their mashed potatoes are the best. Overall pretty much all your staff is friendly!

I've been coming to this Chilis location for 7 years. But this year I have been asking my wife why we keep coming to this location. They made the menu smaller which is a good idea since having such a huge menu not only confuses the customers but it also makes it difficult for the kitchen to make food quickly and well. Unfortunately that doesn't seem to be the case for this location. This is supposed to be the flagship Chilis but they don't seem to be acting like it. I knew an employee for Chilis that had told us that they were going to start using a conveyor belt oven to cook all of the food, when I heard about that it seems like all the trouble started happening. The service is horrible, waitresses will show up to your table once in a while. Good luck getting a refill. Food is always late or never shows up. Food is frequently cold. And some of the changes to the menu are not good, the queso dip for example which used to be really good is now just a gross mess. The chicken crunchers are different as well, I don't know why they messed with the recipe. The manager however is always very understanding of the situation but I don't understand why they can't fix the problem. It's really sad to see a restaurant that I used to enjoy bringing my family to become so dysfunctional.  So in conclusion, the food quality is very inconsistent and the service is terrible. This has happened too many times and every time we give them another chance they screw up. I don't know about the other Chili's locations but this one really needs to clean up house and get staff that actually care about what they are doing.
I order the new ultimate bacon burger and OMG, was so good. I couldn't finish it. If you are extremely hungry, this is the right choice.
Javier server is amazing!!!! Literally! From the poor service I had earlier from another restaurant to here is refreshing!!!!! Grade A server

Worst experience EVER!!! first i ordered appetizers of which took forever to come. Then i ordered my meal for myself and husband of the ancho salmon and steak i made it a combo "as i always do" every time i come here never an issue!! Then i get this waitress that makes the 2 combos into 4 because she said it just sounds wierd to order!! Then when  i advised her its wrong she tried to debate with me!! Like huh.. aint i the person placing an order here NOT YOU!!  Then the manager came out and tried to debate my order aswell!!  Like are these people foreal! It was so much back & forth that we left we did not eat! We paid for the appetizers that were eaten then left! Im sorry chilis wont be getting my buisness any more atleast this location EVER! Especially at this time of day!  HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!

Overall good food. I think the fajitas are one of the best things they offer. They changed the menu and removed about half of the food choices. I was disappointed with that. Stopped in for lunch and paid $16 which included the tip. Thought that was expensive for a cup of soup and a half chicken sandwich.  The prices are high for what you get. $3 for a Coke?  I enjoyed their old menu better. Of course they're charging more for everything hence the new menu.

Like others have said, this place is a hit or a miss. It a nice spot after shopping in the area. They offer a good variety of food. I never had a bad experience here with the food, always delicious. However, the service needs some work. It's very very very slow. After we got seated it takes 8 min to get the waiter to our table, on a so so busy lunch. The food always takes a while, a salad and medium rare should not be that long. It's convenient that they made the self checkouts now, you don't need to be kept hostage to pay your bill.

Chili's always seems a little sticky to me - probably because of all the families and babies, but this location is pretty nice. My husband had the sirloin tacos and I had the shrimp fajitas and we really enjoyed both. Our server was super nice too.
Food ok as usual but our server today don't seem happy serving us. Maybe because it's already past 9pm and he is tired. He does not look like a happy camper.

Always a good time, good food, good service. The 2 for $20 is a great value, or you can get two select cocktails and do 2 for $35. The two for's includes an appetizer for two, two entrees, and a dessert. My family loves the ribs, the cajun pasta, the sirloin steaks which are always cooked to perfection, and the loaded mashed potatoes! I can only eat like this every once in a while, but when I do, it's often Chili's! Also, if you're a chocolate lover, the molten lava cake is a must!

Our server and bartender, Matthew, was more interested in talking to his friend at the other end of the bar than serving us.  We were the only two others at the bar.  It took forever to get the water we wanted and even longer to place our order.  When the food came, the was all dried out and the fries tasted like they had been fried twice.  When Matthew did come over to check in on us, he asked if everything was good I said no and he just walked away.  I won't be going back!

I've been through here a couple times recently, something I'm not proud of.  Trying to eat "better" lately.  At the times I assumed it was a good plan since Chili's like so many other chains are running these specials; 2 entrees + 1 dessert & appetizer for $20.  Sounds like a great penny pinching deal, but the food works your mechanisms to ruin.  I think the food they use for the specials are pumped with extra cholesterol, MSG, butter and anything that adds more fat.  After having two meals off the special price menu, soon after consumption I felt lazy, tired, bloated and uncomfortable.  Both times I didn't finish the meal and while I did pack it to go, I ended up throwing it away.  My feelings were, if I went through them again I would suffer with the ill feelings all over.  Both times I ate at the restaurant so I had the appetizer and dessert also.  I would think they probably add more butter and such to make you feel full.  These combos are a lot of food.  The dessert both times were much too sweet to consume alone and since these times I'd eaten with friends that were "dieting" I ended up trying all alone.  Failure both times.  Service at this location is hit or miss, slow, thoughtless serving the first time and then "excellent-I-plan on sharing this experience with management" type during the second visit.  Once I went in the early afternoon and the other at night, both times the restaurant was hella busy and at night the bar was crowded.  Over the last decade this location has done well with repeat business or just being busy at all times. Parking is shared since its located within a strip mall, but you can definitely get a good spot most anytime.

I have an intestinal disorder so my meals have to modified quite a bit. I understand that can be hard on the server, so I never fuss when I have to send a meal back or something gets screwed up. But lately, the wait staff here are almost in la-la land when taking your order because nothing comes back correct, even after the 3RD TIME! It got to the point where the manager had to come to our table and apologize for the mess up and that the "new" 4th plate of food is coming out. This has happened more than once as well.

I love Chilis and while the service seems to be declining a bit, I will continue frequenting this place because of the great Chips and Queso, Boneless Buffalo Wings and Molten Lava Cake. I've been to this restaurant entirely too many times to comment on each individual trip but I do recommend sitting in the bar area as I've had more attentive service than in the dining room section, and the bar waitress, Bertha, is great.

First time ever eating at a Chili's.  Food was decent but not worth the price IMO.  There were a few gross pieces of lettuce in the salad and they also put a lot of cheese in the salad even though we asked for none due to a dairy allergy.  We had a good server though, attentive and nice.  Chili's is one of those normal franchise restaurants but this location let me down. :(
The food is fine when I come to this chili's but if the customer service was as good as the food they would be great.
Great deals and good food! Staff is always super friendly. I personally love the mango salsa tilapia entree. Can't go wrong with their 2 for 20 deal, two entrees and appetizer!

Terrible service, average and overpriced food. Today they ruined my lunch break. After waiting ten minutes for someone to help me, they said they never received my online order. I had the email confirmation right in front of me on my phone. Nonetheless, they told me I could wait another 20 minutes for my food. Had no time for that, had to return to the office having eaten nothing at all. I've eaten here several times in the last few months, and I'd say at least 3/4 of the time, they messed my order up. No joke!  This was the last straw. Never going back!

Nachos are amazing with cheese some brown sauce some jalapenos some quacamole and some sour cream.  However, the last time I was here, they had some gross chicken on the nachos with no quacamole.   The margaritas are definately at the top of the pyramid and the molten lava dessert cake is something that just melts in your mouth.  It's so soft and hot on the inside while its hard and cold on the outside.  Inconsistent, but it's worth take the risk because when they get it right, it's right on.

Yesterday I had an awful experience at this  ,since it was Saturday we were given the beeper thing beccause all the tables were filled.We were told that our wait would be from 15-25 minutes.We went back to the car which was really close to the door,after 30 minutes passed we went back in and the hostess said that our table was called 15 minutes ago and they" looked for us"....apparently they forgot to "page" us.We got seated Right by the kitchen..I don't understand why any restaurant would have seats THAt close to the kitchen but I could basically see the chefs cooking and sometimes the food BURNED and I had to smell it.Our appetizer was great we had the trio of mini hamburgers,mini chicken sandwiches,and hot chicken strips..This was NOT enough food for the price but it was good.The drink menu was typical of this type of chain.I had a Jamaican something and it was good. My date ordered chicken pasta and I ordered half rack original ribs,half garlic lime shrimp W/black beans and loaded mashed potatoes.....Most of it  was gross and My food was COLD..WTF?..I was RIGHT by the kitchen.I usually take half my food home when I go out but WOW...how can you mess up ribs..and aren't ribs supposed to be BBQ'd not baked?I want to give one star but my appetizer and drink were good so I gave 2,but I will never go here again.

Overall Chili's is an all right restaurant.  I usually order one of their burger entrees, last time I ordered the burger with mushrooms and swiss.  Burger was cooked to my liking, which I was asked and said medium.  Fries were, okay.  And service here was good. Overall, good food, good service, okay prices.  Will definitely return in the future whenever in the neighborhood.

Not to try to repeat what I've written for the Evanston location, I usually go to this particular location for lunch.  If time permits, I'll go to the theater that's on Carpenter.  I have no complaints about the lunch service times or friendliness of the staff.  I usually sit in the bar and lounge area, and can get in and out within 30 minutes.   If you've seen the special on the Food Network that goes into detail about how restaurants like Chili's have such a consistent tasting menu nation-wide, you'll know how they do it.  All sauces, condiments, and foods come pre-portioned or come in containers by weight.  6 shrimp, two scoops of garlic butter emulsion, a package of veggies, some pasta, etc. gives you consistent seafood pasta.  It's not a surprise that they would do this, nor is this a particularly bad approach.   The drink specials at Chili's are also attractive.   More often than not, I stick with their beer specials.  It's fairly easy to understand: 3 and 4 dollar regular sized drafts, and 4 and 5 dollar large sized drafts.  The regular sized drafts are more than sufficiently sized, but it's always nice to drink a couple of the larger ones when transportation home is pre-arranged.

I'm a regular here... just tried the red velvet molten lava cake.  It comes with cream cheese fudge! Try it, it's a limited time offering.  Definitely not as good as the original (it tastes too doughy), but it's far better than the white chocolate.

It's a Chili's, what do you expect? The food here is good.  I actually really enjoy eating at Chili's because I dont think I have ever really had a bad meal. I had a grilled chicken sandwich with bacon and cheese - it was awesome!  Andmy friend I was with had some insane BBQ Burger with Bacon and cheese - which literally was almost bigger then her head.  I tried it, and my heart thanked me for its greasy goodness. Service is a little iffy at times, but again, its a chain that can get pretty busy.  Great place to stop though right before you see a movie at the Village Crossing Theatre.
Margaritias...nuff sed.

I love me some Chili's! I am a HUGE lover of steak and Chili's is one of my favorite places to chew one down. FLAME-GRILLED RIBEYE is usually my choice of entrée. I like it either medium or medium well depending on what location. The side orders are fantastic... mmmm, mash potatoes... FYI, I have tried almost everything on the menu so let me tell you that everything on the menu is de-li-cious! If you are a rib fan then I strongly recommend you try the Baby Back Ribs!  Chili's Baby Back Ribs... With BBQ Sauce!!! Sorry I couldn't resist They are a little stingy with the sauce [Original, Habanero, Honey BBQ, Memphis Dry Rub, Brown Sugar Chile Rub or Honey-Chipotle] so if you like you ribs soaked you should let you waiter/waitress known. The drinks are good and if you like a Margarita then you MUST HAVE one, replace the Cuervo with a nice tequila, I recommend Patron. The service is great! Everyone is friendly and they really try hard to make you visit a good one! The prices are also very reasonable! A lot of parking so I just can't see a reason why you can not at least give this place a shot.

Boo this chili's  i happen to have a soft spot for chili's..but no more!!   It so happens that we were in the area (the chili's of choice is in the loop) and we decided to stop in for one of their uh-mazing salads and o course the bottomless chips and salsa. During the course of our meal....we were ignored by the waiter..we waited forever for our food.....and we never quite got our chips and salsa...   oh yeah and we had to leave out money on the table because we never actually managed to get the waiters attention for long enough to get a bill.... The absolute saddest part of all......it wasn't even busy when we went...there were approximately 12 tables open in OUR area....        Consumers beware when going to this chilis..the service sucks and the meal was strangely unfulfilling!!

Chili's is dependable.  I actually prefer eating at Chili's Too! at the airport, but that's because the service is super quick. At this location, the wait is a world of hurt.  I recently went to the downtown Chili's and guess what?  No wait on a Saturday at 8pm.  Some notables:  The queso is a bit on the beany side.  I'm always happy with their burgers.  Buffalo Chicken sandwich is a safe bet as well.   Also, if you are on a date, there is no need to impress by ordering the most expensive dish.  The Return on Taste (ROT) diminishes after you pass the $12 mark per entree.

PRESIDENTE MARGARITA!!! Mmmmmm...... this was the best part of my meal. This is a chain, and the food is pretty much the same at every location.  I had a combo of ribs and grilled shrimp; not great, but edible. Our server was nice, and when I told her it was my mom's birthday, she brought over her dessert with a group of servers to sing. My mom loved it. I wouldn't, but that's just me. Not much else to say, except we were in and out pretty quickly.

Well it's been a while since I have been here but it is definitely like it was years back.Depending on when you go here and how busy they are determines the speed and quality of the food.I do think the staff could pick it up a bit and pay more attention to their customers needs as I feel like we have to keep requesting help in order to get our needs taken care of.The food is mediocre.The chips were fresh and light and the best part of going here.Hopefully things change and things get a little better and I'll keep coming back for those Baby Back Ribs.

Delicious spinach artichoke with chip and salsa start from Carlos C, got us off on the right foot. Burgers and fries were just as good always, but sadly no room for the great looking deserts. Will gladly come back. Nice staff and food, a great mix.
Had an excellent meal here yesterday and our server, Ron, was really great. This location is a million times better than the location in North Riverside.

The food is good, the downfall is their service in the to go department. I ordered a side salad and a soup and they told me to come get it in 10 minutes. I get there a little after 10 minutes and I still had to stand there an additional 10 minutes just to get a salad and soup. Very slow service if you ask me.

When I'm out with Jason, we like sitting in the bar area. We prefer the booth for 2 along the perimeter by the window sill. This is because the table itself is small. The ledge displaces the clutter which gives us more square footage for food and drink. Jason's favorite dish is the Trio Fajitas so there's no chance we'll ever agree on saving a few dollars by ordering one of their 2 for $20 or 2 for $35 couple meal deals.  I ordered their New Chicken Club Quesadillas. I didn't need to order a side of guacamole for $.99 because it's already included in my dish. Someone should come by and clear our table while we're eating. They gave us refills but didn't bother taking our empty glasses and a fajita platter comes with multiple plates; things started to accumilate quickly, leaving us with little room to eat comfortably. It was not until we were ready for dessert that we were given a fresh start with a clear table! We weren't able to agree on what to share so we ordered the Brownie Sundae accompanied by Molten Chocolate Cake.

Terrible restaurant. Never get carry out. The chicken was really raw. The fries were all cold. I picked up my food and drive home. Went back to complain and they gave me "fresh" food back. At least they have me a refund and food back. Their service isn't bad at all. Their cooks are the problem, and are hurting their business. This used to be the best Chilis back in the day (like six years ago). If you want to go to a Chilis with good, well cooked, food go to Evanston or Barrington.

I came in to this restaurant with my husband and family. To make the story  short, the waiter broth someting different  of what he ordered. To top it off, the salad  that my husband decided to eat anyway was kind of yellowish,  so ge decided to talk to the manager named Rose WAlker, who shouted  at my husband , this is not the first time, you have complained!!. I was amazed, because this was our second time, on this restaurant in a year. So i asked her howmany times she had saw us in this restaurant?, and Ms. Walker, responded, l even saw you too!!!! Ms. Walker, the manager  started shoutong; yes!!, you have been here with a different  hairstyle.  I considere this being a bully act, . She lack of people skills, and has a paranoid behavior.

It was my first time at Chili's ...I can't say enough that the service, food and beverages were outstanding...I had the 8.00 create your own enchiladas with rice and beans...and they were delicious...I told out waitress every thing was great and that I was sure to return with my family...Thanks for the excellent service...

This Saturday afternoon, this place was a zoo. Scratch that, a zoo would have been a better place to sit down and grab a bite to eat.  The people all seemed to be obnoxious, terribly rude and inconsiderate. Once getting seated, we were abandoned. About 5 servers passed by us and completely ignored us.  Fifteen minutes after sitting down, I'd had enough. We should have at least been given water and someone to tell us that they'd be with us at some point in the near future. I've never outright just left a restaurant like I did on Saturday but this time it was completely justified.
Decent Restaurant. No different than most. Had the margarita deal with their 2 for $20. Sat in the bar area, pretty solid for a average Wednesday night
Listen what can you expect from a chain.  But they have really overhauled their menu, so if you want to see something different give it a shot!

On Sunday night 12/23/12  my husband and myself decided to try something new, we figured we had never been to chili's grill and bar and agreed to try it. The experience was horrible from the food to the management. In my order I specifically asked for a diet coke and a burger with no onions not only did I get a regular coke      ( the person is diabetic) but I also got onions on my burger. He continued on and charged me anyway, I paid because maybe he thought that I was looking for any excuse to get a free meal. The point of the matter is that this manager and his crew is not properly trained.  Matt and your server I forgot to tip you so here: 1.Learn how to do your job. 2. Matt maybe if you had a friendly face I would have stood to eat the burger 3.Matt you should really work on your customer service.

Got food poisoning from chicken fajitas. It tasted like a cleaning chemical used in the cooking process. Threw up about twenty minutes later, and concerned about health violations. Eat at your own risk. The most awful food experience in my life.
Its a decent place to go for good food. I can't promise the best atmosphere, but my boyfriend and I often go for like date days. :) They have a wide range of foods and they are decently priced.

Today was my first sunday off work in months,so me  and my husband decided to go to chilis were we have gone several times before.we got there around1p.m. we were greeted by a young man with no personality he sat us at the smallest table in the place. Then the waiter Darius comes to the tables ask if we want drinks my husband ordered a triple berry margarita I got ice water we also ordered the triple sampler. we get the drinks then we placed our  order which  was the fajatas for two. Time goes  by and the waiter brings the sides that come with the fajatas  then a couple minutes later the fajatas come.I ask the waiter weres are appetizer he looks at us like he  was stoned out of his mind and said wow j didnt no you ordered that.And on top of it he only brought us fajatas for one which let me tell you was all   this point I just wanted the hell out of there.You would think he would of apologized and ask if we wanted something else or if he could correct his mistakes but he   we ate the fajatas I mean the plate of onions and the waiter never even check back we had to hunt him down for the bill.
